TextBody:
Hello,

I just wanted to let you know that the link you shared does not show me anything.
Are you referring to the advisory to update the server to 5.9.4.1?
Can you please confirm your current Epp server version?

You mentioned you applied a patch before, and the version did not change. Is there any error shown in "Dashboard > Live Update"?

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

TextBody:
Hello,

Ok, can anything be seen in "Dashboard > Live Update" on the UI?

If there is nothing shown, you can try to update the server following the steps below.

Before applying any update, please create a VM snapshot to create a safe point to return to in case of any issues.
Pease apply the patches one at a time and wait 10-20 minutes for each patch to apply before importing the next update.
1. In the Epp server, please go to "Dashboard > Live update > Offline Patch Uploader"
- Select the next update in line
- Click "Upload Patch"
- Wait for the notification that the patch is uploaded

2. Wait 10 minutes for the patch to install.
- Refresh the webpage to see if the server version has been updated.
- If the version changed, the patch finished installing and you can try to import the next update.

Please find the available offline patches below.
Epp 5.8.1.0 to 5.9.0.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500615900.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.0.0 to 5.9.1.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500625910.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.1.0 to 5.9.2.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500635920.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.2.0 to 5.9.3.0:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500645930.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.3.0 to Epp 5.9.4.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP00656940.tar.gz  
Epp 5.9.4.0 to Epp 5.9.4.1
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500665941.tar.gz

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

PHISHING ALERT 


This email has been sent from an account outside of the BAE Systems network.

Be aware that this could be a phishing attempt. For more guidance, search "phishing email" on Connect. If you think this is a phishing email report it using the "PhishMe" button on Outlook.  


 



Hello,

Ok, can anything be seen in "Dashboard > Live Update" on the UI?

If there is nothing shown, you can try to update the server following the steps below.

Before applying any update, please create a VM snapshot to create a safe point to return to in case of any issues.
Pease apply the patches one at a time and wait 10-20 minutes for each patch to apply before importing the next update.
1. In the Epp server, please go to "Dashboard > Live update > Offline Patch Uploader"
- Select the next update in line
- Click "Upload Patch"
- Wait for the notification that the patch is uploaded

2. Wait 10 minutes for the patch to install.
- Refresh the webpage to see if the server version has been updated.
- If the version changed, the patch finished installing and you can try to import the next update.

Please find the available offline patches below.
Epp 5.8.1.0 to 5.9.0.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500615900.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.0.0 to 5.9.1.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500625910.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.1.0 to 5.9.2.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500635920.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.2.0 to 5.9.3.0:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500645930.tar.gz
Epp 5.9.3.0 to Epp 5.9.4.0
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP00656940.tar.gz  
Epp 5.9.4.0 to Epp 5.9.4.1
https://download.endpointprotector.com/offline_patches/EPP500665941.tar.gz

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector
